MoMs - Event_Exhibitions: PM Vishwakarma Exhibition cum Trade Fair at Margao

To facilitate Udyam Registration during PM Vishwakarma Exhibition cum Trade Fair at Margao organised by MSME-DFO & DHTC for Goan Artisan, Handicrafts of State and to create awareness about Ecommerce plateform benefits, eligibility, and government support schemes.

1.	Awareness on Government of India Schemes and RAMP Programme
o	Beneficiaries were provided detailed information about various central government schemes relevant to artisans and handicraft entrepreneurs.
o	Briefly orientated about RAMP program and its BFC & WEFC functions.
o	Eligibility criteria, benefits, and application processes were explained in simple language.
2.	Orientation on ONDC (Open Network for Digital Commerce)
o	The concept, objectives, and significance of ONDC were explained.
o	Participants were oriented on how ONDC can enable wider market access, transparency, and digital inclusion for small producers and artisans.
3.	Awareness on GeM (Government e-Marketplace) Scheme
o	The importance and benefits of the GeM portal were discussed.
o	Artisans were informed about opportunities to sell their products directly to government departments and PSUs through the platform.
4.	Udyam Registration Facilitation
o	On-the-spot support was provided for Udyam Registration of artisans and handicraft units.
o	Assistance was also given for updating existing Udyam profiles to ensure compliance and access to scheme benefits.
5.	TEAM Portal Registration
o	Artisans and handicraft beneficiaries were registered on the TEAM (Trade Enablement and Marketing) portal to enhance their digital presence and market linkage.

MoMs - departmental visits:
Planning a 5-day dedicated helpdesk at Thivim IDC for MSME support under the RAMP program.
•	Confirm timelines, promotion, and data strategies.
•	Align on helpdesk dates and pre-event preparations.
•	Address MSME pain points for targeted support.

The IDC President endorsed the helpdesk, appreciating RAMP's role in MSME growth. Discussion and agreement reached on pre-event data collection and joint execution.
Helpdesk Dates: Proposed and agreed: February 2nd to 6th, 2026 (11 AM – 4:30 PM daily).
Planning and Notification: Finalize plans and notify stakeholders 8 days prior via email/SMS.
Promotion: Install ads on both gates and canteens one week prior (by January 26, 2026).
Pre-Event Data Collection: Circulate Google Form 10 days prior to gather MSME info on pain points, problems, schemes needed, and linkages.
Linkage Data: Compile forward/backward linkage data during helpdesk via surveys.
Mail detailed Agenda and Plan of Action (PoA) to IDC President for approval.
Ms. Saina P. Shirodkar, Technical Assistant, GEDA
Ferdin Sylvester                   Megha Dalal                      Nithin K.
Discuss ongoing and upcoming initiatives, and to explore potential areas of collaboration for RAMP, BFC, and WEFC activities

Introduction
A meeting was held with Ms. Saina P. Shirodkar, Technical Assistant at GEDA, to discuss ongoing and upcoming initiatives, and to explore potential areas of collaboration for RAMP, BFC, and WEFC activities.

Key Discussion Points
•RAMP, BFC, and WEFC Presence
We briefed Ms. Shirodkar on the scope and presence of RAMP, BFC, and WEFC in Goa and explored opportunities for integration with GEDA’s initiatives.
•Pilot Projects in Selected Panchayats
GEDA is planning pilot interventions in three panchayats—Calangute, Cacra, and Haverlem panchayat.
The objective is to assess current local initiatives and identify how GEDA and partnering entities can support and enhance these efforts.
•GIZ Energy Roadmap – Phase II
Ms. Shirodkar informed us that GIZ has completed Phase I of the Energy Roadmap for Goa, which was launched at the G20 Summit in 2023.
Phase II will now focus on implementing the roadmap, including:
• Pilot implementation in the three identified panchayats
• Promotion of green cooking solutions
• Electrification and support for tribal hostels
• Development of a bioenergy policy
• Expansion of solar energy initiatives
• Other renewable and sustainable energy actions
•Deployment of FMC – MSME Cluster Personnel
GEDA has appointed 5–6 personnel through FMC – MSME Cluster to work full-time with the three pilot panchayats for one year.
Their mandate includes demonstrating tangible improvements and measurable outcomes within the project duration.
•E-Boat and Fishing Sector Electrification Initiative
GEDA is developing a roadmap for the electrification of fishing boats (e-boats) through retrofitting.
This initiative is being undertaken in collaboration with a NABARD-associated entity from Kerala.
A detailed survey and study will be conducted, following which a pilot project will be launched. Charging infrastructure will also be planned as part of this initiative.
•Proposed Competition for Women SHG Groups
GEDA is planning to launch a competition for women Self-Help Groups (SHGs) to propose business ideas that incorporate an energy-based component.
• Two winning SHGs will be selected.
• Each winner will be awarded ₹12.5 lakh as prize funding to establish or scale their proposed business.
•Collaboration with GIZ on SHG conversation Models
GEDA, in association with GIZ, is working on a model for the conversing of SHG groups.
GEDA will serve as the nodal agency for this initiative.
A similar model has already been successfully implemented in Punjab.

To brief Mr. Cyril about the RAMP Programme and the role of BFC & WEFC. To discuss collaboration opportunities between WTC and BFC/WEFC for MSME support.

• Meeting was convened to explore collaboration opportunities between the Directorate of Industries, Trade and Commerce (DITC) and the World Trade Centre (WTC) Goa.
• Mr. Cyril D’Souza provided an overview of the global operations of WTC, comprising over 300 centres across 100 countries.
• It was informed that WTC Goa currently has a network of around 60 MSMEs and works in coordination with the MSME Development and Facilitation Office (DFO) to conduct Udyam registration camps.
• The discussion included details of the WTC Mumbai event, where MSMEs are provided stall space through collaboration with DRDA.
• WTC Goa expressed willingness to collaborate with DITC, however, requested the signing of an MoU to outline the scope of partnership and mutual benefits.

To brief DRDA livelihood team about the RAMP Programme and the role of BFC & WEFC.
To discuss collaboration opportunities between DRDA and BFC/WEFC for MSME support.
To identify on-ground challenges faced by MSMEs and SHG-based enterprises.
To understand specific support required from BFC & WEFC to strengthen livelihood initiatives

• BFC & WEFC team explained their role across finance, business, legal, export, IT, ESG and compliance domains.
• Discussed collaborative efforts to assist MSMEs and SHGs through awareness, guidance, and training.
• DRDA team highlighted key challenges:
• Difficulties in NOC, FSSAI, and trade registrations due to property ownership issues.
• Limited awareness about schemes, ONDC, and GeM.
• Raw material shortage issues & procurement issues
• Most SHGs are involved in tailoring, papad/snacks making, catering, handicrafts, masala production, and candles & agarbatti making.
• Requested BFC & WEFC support for branding, packaging, labelling, ONDC/GeM sessions, and licensing guidance.
• Discussed the role of social media marketing to enhance MSME visibility.
• WhatsApp coordination group was created with DRDA and BFC/WEFC teams for smooth communication.

Confederation of Indian Industry Goa
Manashi Kowadkar (BFC)
Yogesh Kumar (BFC)
For Team Initiative (ONDC Registration) of 500 MSMEs.
For Introductory Meeting about RAMP-BFC&WEFC
To know about upcoming events and workshops they are planning in which we can participate 
Visited 2 places NSIC office CII Fountainhas
• The team initially visited the NSIC office but could not locate it at the listed address. The visit was then redirected to the CII Goa office.
• A brief introduction was given about our team and our initiatives to support MSMEs through various schemes and programs.
• CII shared that they primarily work with small and medium enterprises and have a database of approximately 3,000 MSMEs from GIDC, though only a few are currently active. Their main focus areas include facilitating loans, private equity connections, and B2B meetings.
• Detailed discussion held with Mr. Sagar Chatterjee regarding their ongoing initiatives and upcoming MSME-focused events.
• CII is planning a session on logistics for MSMEs tentatively on 15 November 2025, which may be postponed to January 2026.
• An Annual Day event is scheduled for March 2026.
• They are also planning sessions on Tourism Opportunities and Packaging, which are under finalization.
• A proposed event on AI incorporation in machine manufacturing and robotics is being planned for April or May 2026 (yet to be finalized).
• CII requested information on government schemes related to R&D or funding support for shipyard manufacturing vendors.
• We briefed them on the TEAM initiative and ONDC platform. Mr. Chatterjee mentioned that any MSME approaching them for ONDC onboarding would be referred to our team.
• He also requested a catalogue of available MSME schemes and BFC & WEFC details in PDF format to circulate within their MSME group.

To understand the functioning and key activities of the Directorate of Fisheries, Government of Goa, including their operational structure, ongoing initiatives, and event management processes, and to explore opportunities for collaboration and participation in upcoming fisheries- related programs under the RAMP framework.

• The Superintendent will be the main point of contact for information on upcoming fisheries events and participation procedures.
• Opportunities identified for collaboration with BFC and WEFC teams in awareness, training, and business linkage programs related to the marine and allied sectors.
• Plan to participate in forthcoming departmental events and introduce the objectives of BFC and WEFC among fishermen and local stakeholders. Coordination to continue for field-level engagement and promotion of MSME-related services under the RAMP framework.
